dates.event: Italian Giuseppe Farina wins the first Grand Prix of the Formula One World Championship held at Silverstone (Great Britain).
Giuseppe Farina becomes the first Formula One World Champion.
Argentine Juan Manuel Fangio wins his 5th Formula One World Championship title at the NÃ¼rburgring circuit (Germany).
Introduction of the V8 engine developed by Climax and B.R.M. in Formula One.
Introduction of the Ford-Cosworth engine in Formula One.
British driver Jim Clark dies at Hockenheim (Germany).
Introduction of wings on Formula One cars.
Creation of the ground effect Formula One car: the Lotus 78.
First victory of a turbocharged Formula One car, with French driver Jean-Pierre Jabouille driving the Renault.
Ban of ground effect Formula One cars.
First World Championship title for a turbocharged Formula One car, with Brazilian driver Nelson Piquet driving for Brabham-BMW.
Alain Prost becomes the first French Formula One World Champion.
Introduction of active suspension (computer-controlled hydraulic suspension) in Formula One.
Ban of turbocharged engines in Formula One.
Alain Prost wins his fourth Formula One World Championship title and retires from racing.
Brazilian driver Ayrton Senna dies at Imola (Italy).
German driver Michael Schumacher wins 13 Grand Prix races in a year and becomes World Champion for the 7th time.
Spanish driver Fernando Alonso (Renault) becomes the youngest ever Formula One World Champion at 24 years old.
Michael Schumacher sets the record for the most pole positions in his career with 66, surpassing Ayrton Senna. He holds all Formula One records at the time.
British driver Lewis Hamilton becomes the first driver of color to win the Formula One World Championship.
German driver Sebastian Vettel becomes the youngest ever Formula One World Champion at 23 years and 4 months old.
Sebastian Vettel becomes World Champion for the third consecutive time.
Introduction of new hybrid power unit (1.6L V6 turbocharged engine with energy recovery systems) in Formula One.
Nico Rosberg becomes World Champion for the first time, and retires from racing soon after.
Lewis Hamilton wins his fifth Formula One World Championship title.
Lewis Hamilton wins his sixth Formula One World Championship title, becoming the second driver with the most titles, after Michael Schumacher.
Lewis Hamilton wins his seventh Formula One World Championship title, equaling Michael Schumacher's record.
Max Verstappen wins his first Formula One World Championship title, becoming the first Dutch driver to do so.
